intro: Capsella schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's chickweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and stream banks. It produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
